greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 1 / M(1,sqrt(2)) (Gauss's constant).
comment: On May 30, 1799, Gauss discovered that this number is also equal to (2/Pi)*Integral_{t=0..1} 1/sqrt(1-t^4).
M(a,b) is the limit of the arithmetic-geometric mean iteration applied repeatedly starting with a and b: a_0 = a, b_0 = b, a_{n+1} = (a_n + b_n)/2, b_{n+1} = sqrt(a_n*b_n).
reference: J. M. Borwein and P. B. Borwein, Pi and the AGM, Wiley, 1987, page 5.
J. R. Goldman, The Queen of Mathematics, 1998, p. 92.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Gauss's Constant
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Arithmetic-Geometric Mean
formula: Equals (lim_{k -> infinity} p(k))/(1+i) and (lim_{k -> infinity} q(k))/(1+i), where i is the imaginary unit, p(0) = 1, q(0) = i, p(k+1) = 2*p(k)*q(k)/(p(k)+q(k)) and q(k+1) = sqrt(p(k)*q(k)) for k >= 0. - _A.H.M. Smeets_, Jul 26 2018
Equals the infinite quotient product (3/4)*(6/5)*(7/8)*(10/9)*(11/12)*(14/13)*(15/16)*... . - _James Maclachlan_, Jul 28 2019
mathematica: RealDigits[1/ArithmeticGeometricMean[1, Sqrt[2]], 10, 105][[1]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 13 2011, updated Nov 11 2016, after _Eric W. Weisstein_ *)
program: (PARI) default(realprecision, 20080); x=10*agm(1, sqrt(2))^-1; for (n=0, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b014549.txt", n, " ", d)); \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Apr 20 2009
from mpmath import mp, agm, sqrt
print([int(z) for z in list(str(1/agm(sqrt(2)))[2:-1])]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jul 11 2017
(MAGMA) SetDefaultRealField(RealField(100)); R:= RealField(); Sqrt(Pi(R)/2)/Gamma(3/4)^2; // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 17 2018
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, _N. J. A. Sloane_
